findings.title: Potential Reentrancy Risk in xtoken Repayment
findings.description: Violation of `checks-effects-interactions` principle in `_repay_internal()` function, potentially leading to re-entrancy attacks.

findings.title: Improved ERC20-Compliance Of xtoken
findings.description: ERC20 inconsistency or incompatibility issues found in the `xtoken` contract. Specifically, the current `transfer` function does not properly emit the related `Transfer` event when the sender has sufficient balance to spend.

findings.title: Trust Issue of Admin Keys
findings.description: The `xBank` protocol has a privileged `owner` account that plays a critical role in governing and regulating protocol-wide operations.

findings.title: Improved Sanity Checks For System Parameters
findings.description: DeFi protocols typically have a number of system- wide parameters that can be dynamically configured on demand.

findings.title: Removal of Unused Imports
findings.description: The `xmath_base` implementation has unused imports which are not used in the contract and can be safely removed.

findings.title: Proper log_add_reserves Events Upon Reserve Changes
findings.description: The xtoken contract lacks emitting important events that reflect reserve changes, specifically when there is a liquidation being performed and the new reserve state may be reflected in total_reserves.
